attributes.action: Scrap DBS check fees. Safety of vulnerable people should not come at a price.
attributes.additional_details:
It is extremely plausible that vulnerable people in our society will be put at risk if businesses do not, or cannot afford to complete DBS checks.

Businesses should be able to pay a subscription to gain access to a database to authenticate the intervrity of their employees, opposed to paying between £20 - £60 per check.
attributes.background: Businesses are charged to check the forensic history of employees, to safeguard vulnerable people within the workplace and/or academia. For many businesses this is a very costly overhead. It is not ethical that the safety of vulnerable people is contingent on paying a DBS check fee.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure whether you'd like fees for DBS checks to be scrapped completely, or whether you'd like there to be a subscription service in some or all cases. 

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.
